Good luck to our lady Mustangs!

If you are interested in having your child take advantage of these services, please pick up a form in the front office of the Elementary School and/or the Middle/High School or go to www.myschooldentist.com and print and fill out the form.

All forms are due back to the front office no later than January 31st, however, space is limited so don't wait too long, get them in!

Big Smiles, the mobile dentist, will be at the Elementary School on February 3rd &10th and will be at the Middle High School on February 13th.

LVMHS SPORTS UPDATE, Thursday, January 9: Yesterday saw our high school soccer teams in action as they both took on Excelsior. The girls traveled to Victorville to take on the Eagles. The Mustangs played a competitive game, having multiple opportunities to score but just missing their shots. The girls did drop the game 3-0 and their record is now 2-5-1 and they are in 3rd place in league at 1-3-1.

The boys soccer also took on the Eagles from Excelsior here at Lucerne Valley. They too would play a competitive game with Excelsior but did drop the game 2-1. Junior Omar Orozco scored for the Mustangs and was assisted by senior Emmanuel Velador. Our boys are now 5-8-1 overall and 0-3-1 in league.

Next up for both teams is a road game in Mojave to take on the Mustangs tomorrow afternoon. Girls at 3 pm followed by the boys at 5 pm.

Recently named School Board President Tom Courtney shared these thoughts about outgoing President Jim Harvey and the board’s continuing quest for excellence:

“Well, I am so proud of Jim Harvey I don't know where to begin. He is a Leader’s Leader. When I was interviewed as CSBA's Board member of the month this summer I was asked who I admired in the school board business and it was a simple answer, Jim Harvey. This man has done more to put our board on the state map that I can say. I was board President for 7 years when I nominated Jim to become President. He has educated us on the Brown Act as well as the many other lessons we have had to learn. I am honored to have this position in a year I run for my 7th election. I have had many great experiences at the State Level and hope to continue the work I started 25 years ago of making our choice what is best for students first, staff second and our community at large equal with staff. I will do my best along with Jessica and Chelsea always knowing Jim is available whenever needed.”
